result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Frank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Frank

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per FOSO incarcerated in prison for the next 3 years - request judgment

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant William J. Frank in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 1:49 PM. Called 15CM99, 15CM147 and 15CF174. State - here for change of plea and sentencing on all matters. Lucareli recites agreement: 15CF174 - Count #1 - Defendant would plead G as alleged with a fine of $500,  both side free to argue sentencing. Count #2 - would be dismissed, Count #3 - would be dismissed, Count #4 amend to FC ordinance of DC with MV,  fine of $500 plus costs, Count #5 - would be dismissed, #6 & #7 DE would plead NC as alleged 9 months in FC jail on each count, to run concurrent to each other and any jail sentence that may be imposed in count #1. 15CM99 - #1 - would be DRI, Count #2 - Plead to as alleged, pay restitution of $319.00 to Wisconsin Department of Corrections - Forest County Unit (DOC - monitoring bracelet), 9 months in FC jail, concurrent to Case 15CF174. 15CM147 - #1 would be dismissed, #2 amend to FC ordinance of DC with MV with fine of $500 plus costs. 16CF11 - dismissed by motion of the state previously and will not be re-filed by the state. Case 15CM147 - court dismisses #1, amends #2 to DC with MV - DE pleads NC to amended charge, court finds guilty and imposes fine of $500 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. 15CM99 - #1 - Court DRI, #2 - DE pleads NC as alleged. 15CF174 - #1 - pleads G as alleged, Counts 2, 3 & 5 - court dismisses, Court amends #4 to FC ordinance of DC with MV, DE pleads NC, court finds guilty and imposes fine of $500 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. Counts 6 & 7 - DE pleads NC. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and constitutional rights to trial, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty to all counts plead to. State plays video, marks as exhibit #1, makes final argument and asks for 5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, not entitled for any programs, probation is rejected by the state. Lucareli makes final argument and asks for a imposed probation with county jail time and inpatient treatment through probation. Frank makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences to the following: 15CF174 - Count #1 - Imposes 4 years in WI State Prison System, 2 years of initial confinement, 2 years of extended supervision, court finds the defendant is not eligible for any Challenge Incarceration Programs, $500 fine plus costs and assessments to be paid within 60 days/CO. Counts #6 & #7 - 9 months in FC jail on each count, concurrent to Count 1, costs on each count. 15CM99 - Count #2 - 9 months in FC jail concurrent to 15CF174, restitution to be paid within 10 days/CO, costs. If fail to pay on any fines or restitution commitment for non payment order would be consecutive. 169 days of jail credit, stipulated, DNA sample for each case and expunction rights for DNA given. Appeal, voting rights given and firearms restrictions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on May 26, 2016 at 07:30 am.

Defendant William J. Frank in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Defendant William J. Frank in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:50 PM. Also called 15CM99 and 15CM147. Lucareli - not resolved - Frank agrees. State - 15CF174 - amended offers on 3/30/16  - plead G to count #1 as alleged, amend #2 to second degree reckless endangering, #6 and #7, remaining counts DRI with free to argue and no objection to PSI; 15CM99 - plead to both counts as alleged with 319.00 in restituitojn, free to argue sentencel 15CM147 - dismiss #1 and pelad to #2 as alleged with a fine of $500.00 plus costs and surcharges. Lucareli agrees as does Frank. Frank is rejecting the offer. Lucareli has not gone over Frye with the defendant. Court explains the process of rejecting the offer, offer is no longer available, continues bond on all cases and set all matters for JT. 15CF174 will be #1 JT but set all matters for same day.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 07:30 am.

Defendant William J. Frank in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Defendant William J. Frank in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:03 PM. Also called 15CM99, 15CM147, 15CF174 & 16CF11. State proceeds with PH on 15CF174 and calls Deputy Adam Winkler. Winkler sworn in at 2:05 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:06 PM). Cross exam by Lucareli at 2:10 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (2:11 PM). Re-direct by State at 2:17 PM. Winkler excused at 2:17 PM. Court finds probable cause on 15CF174 and binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Lucareli has Information, waives reading of it, would like to reserve the right to review the transcript, stands mute in respect to all allegations in the Information. Court understands that a motion may be forthcoming, enters NG pleas to all counts for the defendant, continues bond, Lucarelli instructed to file motion within statutory time limits and will set it for a motion hearing once received. 16CF11 - proceed with PH on this matter, State calls Deputy Darrel Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 2:20 PM. Direct exam by State. Lucarelli stipulates to identification of the defendant (2:24 PM). Court accepts stipulation. State asks court to take judicial notice of the identified drug found as a Schedule I or Schedule II narcotics under statute 961.41(3g)(am). Court will take judicial notice of the statute but that is all.  State asks for recess to get information needed for PH. Recess at 2:32 PM. Back on record at 2:44 PM. State moves to dismiss without prejudice and will re-file. Lucareli wants the dismissal for the gamapenten with prejudice. Court dismisses case without prejudice and released from bond on that matter. Court sets all three cases for FPT on 4/4/16 at 2:00 PM and continues bond on them.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant William J. Frank in custody and appears via video from FOSO with attorney Lucareli appearing in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:33 AM. Called 15CF174, 15CM99, 16CF11 and 15CM147. It appears all matters are at an AIA stage. Lucraeli has complaints for all matters but does not believe the defendant has the complaint in 16CF11. Frank states he does not have complaint for 16CF11. Court reads charges and penalties. Lucareli and Frank understand charges and penalties, Lucareli waives further reading. Lucareli stands mute on entering pleas on the misd counts, goes thru right to PH within time limits with defendant and advises that he waive the time limits. Frank does not want to waive time limits. Court enters NG pleas on CM cases and enters NG pleas to all misd counts on the felony cases and sets both felony cases for PH and CM cases for STC. Lucareli again goes over the waiver rights for PH, Frank will now will waive time limits for PH. Defendant is currently on a P&P hold as well as bonds per State. Court continues bond on all matters. Lucareli would like to have a global resolution on all matters. Courts sets CF cases for PH and CM cases for STC. Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. REFUSED TO SIGN

Defendant William J. Frank in court, in custody and appears via video.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:52 AM. Also called 15CM147 and 15CM99. Frank states he does not have complaint for 15CF174. State will get complaint to defendant. Court reads charges and penalties for 15CF174 and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Frank underestands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own (Steve Lucarelli). Seems to be confusion if the defendant is still represented by Lucarelli. Court sets all matters for AIA, the new case will also be set for 1/20/16 at 10:30. State - bond - OK with signature bond on signature cases, $10,000.00 cash on 15CF174 with no consumption and no operation of a motor vehicle.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 01-06-2016 09:30 am

Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court and appears telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:58 PM. Also called 15CM147. Lucareli does not know where his client is, moves to withdraw as counsel for stated reasons. Court has Notice of Appearance from Lucareli on 15CM147 and notes indicate that Lucareli be treated as a special appearance on 15CM99. State - makes statement that the defendant will be issued a warrant shortly for other mattes, asks for bond to be forfeited on both cases and asks for bench warrant, body and $100.00 over the already posted bond. Lucareli - no comment. Court forfeits any bond posted, issues bench warrant, body or $1000.00 on each case. Court informs Lucareli to file a motion to withdraw as counsel and Court will sign in.

Defendant William J. Frank in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli who appears telephonically.  Defendant William J. Frank in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:52 AM. Also called 15CM147. Lucareli thanks the Court for allowing him to appear telephonically, has not had a chance to talk to the defendant regarding either complaint, requests that his appearance be treated as a special appearance today for stated reasons. Court has previously advised the client of the charges and penalties. Lucareli will waive further reading of it and stands mute in regards to the entering of any plea. Court reviews files and has not read the complaint in 15CM147 and does so. Lucareli and Frank understand charges and penalties and stands mute on pleas. Court enters NG pleas to all counts, set both matters for FPT. Court - defendant has signature bond on 15CM147 and $1000 cash bond on 15CM99. State - bond - asks court to continue bond on 15CM99 and requests $1000.00 cash bond on 15CM147 for stated reasons. Lucareli - bond - asks for signature bond on both cases. Court continues bond on cases as is and instructs counsel that the defendant has refused to sign the signature bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant William J. Frank in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:23 PM. Frank does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Frank understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, will be hiring Steve Lucareli. Court sets for AIA, court gives ramifications of returning without an attorney. State - bond - $1000 cash bond. Court - bond - $1000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 08-12-2015 09:00 am

Defendant William J. Frank not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:02 AM. No counsel appears either. State - S&C sent to last known address on 6/26/15 and not returned, requests warrant, body or $500.00. Court so orderes.
